author.name: George Pór #StandWithUkraine
author.description: Researcher of enhancing CI & collective wisdom @ all scales up to #PlanetarySapience w/ knowledge ecology, #symmathesy, lore, inner/outer technologies. @RnDAO__

html: “‘For years, the application of user-centered and human-centered design advocated by so many has often separated people from ecosystems. Now, designers must start to address people as part of an ecosystem rather than at the center of everythin.” — @fjord https://t.co/8DsHNQDh6G

author.name: Reduct.Video
author.description: 🎥 Think with the ideas in your video. Search, review, analyze, synthesize, edit—collaboratively, in the browser.

author.name: Jason Scott
author.description: Proprietor of https://t.co/sdyjXHCZF7, historian, filmmaker, archivist, storyteller. Works on/for the Internet Archive. Rank Amateur.

author.name: Andy Matuschak
author.description: More wonder, more insight, more capacity, more joy!\n\nCurrently exploring tools that augment human memory and attention.

html: A few folks have contacted me, worried that their design portfolio is outdated and they don't have enough time to make a new one.\n\nI know the deadline's tight: if you're concerned about this, feel free to record a 5-10m Loom talking through disorganized artboards / folders / etc.

author.description: convivial forms, some at  https://t.co/3CLjEiF9ND \ https://t.co/Z6r7XU2izD…

html: @Prigoose Software is not as teleological instrument careening towards automation and ease, but a medium for intimacy with the matter of our time (images, audio, video), yielding a sense of agency with what, to most, feels like an indelible substrate.

author.name: soul nate
author.description: forbes' 7.4 billion under 7.4 billion. @mnateshyamalan@mstdn.social

html: i’m in a code review with elon musk. ive got the CSS for https://t.co/iXbfr5d1Jg on 3 monitors. my browser’s in dark mode so it looks cool. “this part?” he asks, pointing to code for the Giant Omelette. “caches tweets in the mainframe cyberhex,” i say. he nods. “as i suspected”

html: i’m in a code review with elon musk. ive got the CSS for https://t.co/iXbfr5d1Jg on 3 monitors. my browser’s in dark mode so it looks cool. “this part?” he asks, pointing to code for the Giant Omelette. “caches tweets in the mainframe cyberhex,” i say. he nods. “as i suspected”

author.name: Alan Laidlaw
author.description: Too academic for business, too business for academia.

html: Screenshots as default behavior. Like 👍something ->automatically get a screenshot of thing (+thread, +comments) w OCR of text in image metadata. \nPhotos becomes default vault of everything you see during the day. (Would have to be redesigned to handle the scope, of course.)\nWhy?

author.name: Codex OS

html: Screenshots as default behavior. Like 👍something ->automatically get a screenshot of thing (+thread, +comments) w OCR of text in image metadata. \nPhotos becomes default vault of everything you see during the day. (Would have to be redesigned to handle the scope, of course.)\nWhy?

author.name: Codex OS

html: Why can't every element on a website be draggable?\n\nIt's a human right! 😁

author.name: Codex OS

html:
What is "responsive design" if it doesn't 𝘳𝘦𝘴𝘱𝘰𝘯𝘥 or even 𝘭𝘪𝘴𝘵𝘦𝘯 to the needs of the user ...

We have a natural desire to move things in the real world, to form arrangements that stimulate our spatial memory & reasoning ...

Yet software is the opposite of soft ... https://t.co/WQMzpVgZGj

author.name: Codex OS

html: What makes a cyberspace is not a VR or AR headset, or 3D or 2D graphics, but one elusive thing: MAXIMUM user agency in whatever environment you present them with ...
